description: Observations to Hackney regarding provision of facilities and pontoons to facilitate the provision of moorings.
decision_conditions:
1. This Council objects to the proposal on the following grounds:- 

 i) conflict with and be detrimental to the recreational use and users of the canal; 

 ii) would be detrimental to the amenity of nearby residential occupiers by reason of noise and disturbance. 

 2. If you are minded however to recommend the proposal for approval I would suggest you consider the following conditions in addition to any you would attach to the decision:- 

 1) no development shall take place until precise details of the service point structures, sanitary, general storage and refuse storage facilities are submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the use commences. 

 2) The service points and associated sanitary storage facilities shall be erected and available for use prior to the occupation of the moorings to be permitted. 

 3) All sewage and foul water shall be disposed of via an approved and designated sewage disposal facility. There shall be no disposal of foul water into the Regent's Canal. 

 4) There shall be no use of generators to provide power to serve the boats without the prior express written permission of the Local Planning Authority. 

 5) No more than 'x' metres of the canal adjoining Holborn studios shall be used for permanent moorings. 

 6) Written details of a management agreement for permanent residential/non-residential moorings shall at first be agreed by the licensing authority, British Waterways and then submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, prior to the use commencing. 

 7) This decision shall be the subject of Agreement relating to the management arrangements for permanent residential/non-residential moorings.
